org.opendaylight.controller.samples.simpleforwarding.internal

Class SimpleBroadcastHandlerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opendaylight.controller.samples.simpleforwarding.internal.SimpleBroadcastHandlerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IListenDataPacket, IBroadcastHandler

    public class SimpleBroadcastHandlerImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements IBroadcastHandler, IListenDataPacket
    The simple broadcast handler simply sends broadcast packets out all ports that are not known to belong to an internal, i.e., switch-switch, link. Note that this is *not* safe in the general case when an OpenDaylight-controlled network has L2 peering with normal a normal L2 network. It is entirely possible for a packet to be flooded to a legacy/non-controlled switch and then be reflected back into the OpenDaylight-controlled region resulting in a loop.

    • Method Detail

      • receiveDataPacket

        public PacketResult receiveDataPacket(RawPacket inPkt)
        Description copied from interface: IListenDataPacket
        Handler for receiving the packet. The application can signal back to SAL if the packet has been consumed or no. In case of packet consumed SAL will prevent to keep passing to subsequent listener in the serial chain, but for handlers without dependency things will keep going . The packet will received will have the IncomingNodeConnector set to understand where the packet is coming from
        Specified by:
        receiveDataPacket in interface IListenDataPacket
        Parameters:
        inPkt - Packet received
        Returns:
        An indication if the packet should still be processed or we should stop it.

        public boolean broadcastPacket(RawPacket pkt)
        Description copied from interface: IBroadcastHandler
        Safely flood/broadcast a RawPacket received on a given NodeConnector.
        Specified by:
        broadcastPacket in interface IBroadcastHandler
        Parameters:
        pkt - The packet to flood/broadcast
        Returns:
        true if the broadcast is successful, false otherwise
